group_1.textLeft: ...That gift was intended for me?
And the voice belonged to the giver,@rather than the recipient...?
Our fundamental premises have all@been thrown into turmoil...

group_1.textRight: I'll accept the facts as they are.
But as a Coordinator, there's something@that doesn't sit right with me.
How did a Magical Girl, Coordinated with@the intent of learning the gift's destination,
instead receive the opposite magic@of tracing its sender?
I'll have to ask my teacher, but this is something@I've never experienced before...

group_1.textLeft: ...[wait:1.0][chara:113701:lipSynch_1]Actually, when it comes to that,
I have a confession to make.

group_1.textRight: ...What is it?

group_1.textLeft: While I truly was hoping to find out where@the gift was intended to be delivered,
I also wanted to know who sent it.

group_1.textRight: ...But why?
There would be no benefit to you,@Nayuta Satomi.

group_1.textLeft: Because those confectioneries were@simply too elaborate...
Who in the world would go@so far for someone?
I just wanted to know what thought@process went into making it.
That was my core desire when@I received the Coordination.
And I'm sure you can already guess@because of our matching outfits,
but that's what was on my mind, too...

group_1.textRight: ...It all makes sense now.
There's no question why your personal magic@would allow you to trace the sender.

group_1.textLeft: What a mess... I do apologize.

group_1.textRight: ...I'm sorry, I didn't mean to sound@accusatory.
...You two are simply too kind,@that's all.

group_1.textLeft: ...I'll go fetch my bag.
…[chara:113702:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:113702:cheek_0][chara:113702:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json][chara:113702:lipSynch_1]Huh?
That ornament we just picked up -@there's no light shining from it.

group_1.textRight: Perhaps that means it was the last one...

group_1.textLeft: But the other one right here@is still glowing.

group_1.textRight: That...must be pointing to the ornaments@in the intended order.

group_1.textLeft: We oughta head towards that@light next, then.

group_1.narration: ―Mikage―@Heeey, Nayutan, are you sure you don't know@anything about that present?
―Nayuta―@I have no idea what's going on.
―Nayuta―@But after hearing the voice of that family's mother,@after she became an old woman,
―Nayuta―@I realize I've heard it many times.
―Mikage―@Then maybe you guys know each other?
―Mikage―@Maybe it's just a gift from@some old granny you know.
―Nayuta―@Th-that can't be so...but if it truly is...
―Nayuta―@What a black heart I must have for being unable@to recall an elderly woman...

group_1.textRight: Found it!

group_1.textLeft: Let's go, then! I wonder what kind@of voice we shall hear next...?

group_1.narration: "So what will the baby's name be?"
"I already know what I'll name my daughter@once she's born - the first one will be named [textRed:Mitama],@and the second will be [textRed:Mikage]."
"I see, so it ties back into the meaning@of your name, Rei-chan."

group_1.textLeft: ...[wait:1.0][chara:113701:lipSynch_1]Huh?

group_1.textRight: Hmm...
I had my suspicion, but I guess@it turned out to be true...

group_1.textLeft: Mikage...? What are you saying?

group_1.textRight: Because the daughter in that family...@Rei-chan's voice...
As she grew up, it sounded more and@more like Mom's voice.
It is said that the voices of parents@and children are similar...
So the voice of this "Rei-chan" in her childhood@sounded familiar to us because...

group_1.textLeft: ...'Cause it sounded like my voice.
And that also explains why it creeped me@out so much.
Like the phenomenon where one is uncomfortable@hearing their own voice played back to them...?

group_1.textRight: Fumu, fumuumu…

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, Rei-chan was my mom's nickname@when she was a kid.
It looks like it was someone in my family...
...who sent the confectioneries@to Nayutan's house.
And it was probably my grandma@who left it there.
But we've heard a lot of people's voices@coming from the ornaments so far.
So maybe Mom or Grandpa was with her@when she left the gift?
Your mother leaving a gift at my house...?
I don't know what that implies...

group_1.textRight: Me neither!
So let's go find the next ornament!
